C.9 Drilling method selection and hence cost depends significantly on what kind of geological formations are present. Please listen to the following categorization carefully, which will be referenced in the next question:
Low-strength formations: unconsolidated formations (sand, silt, clay, gravel), formations that allow for hand-auger, sludging, jetting or rotary drilling.
Medium-strength formations: shale, sandstone. These formations generally do not allow hand-auger, sludging or jetting but do require percussion drilling or rotary drilling.
High-strength formations: limestone, Igneous or Metamorphic rock (e.g. granite, basalt, slate, gneiss) generally requiring down-the-hole percussion drilling.
